title: Mihawk's Limited Training Theory
theoryText: Some fans theorize that Zoro didn't train with Mihawk for the full two years. Instead, after initial instruction, Mihawk may have taken Zoro to other swordsmen on the Grand Line to train and fight, or simply made Zoro aware of Haki's existence and left him to train with the humandrills.
author: One Piece Fandom Community

title: 3D2Y Message Setup Theory
theoryText: Episode 509's decision by Luffy to return to Marineford was carefully planned by Rayleigh as a way to send a coded message to the Straw Hats. The '3D2Y' message (crossing out '3 Days' to mean '2 Years') would inform the scattered crew to train for two years before reuniting, rather than the original three-day reunion plan.
author: Multiple sources

title: Humandrills as Zoro's True Teachers
theoryText: A theory suggests that the humandrills, not Mihawk, were Zoro's primary training partners during the timeskip. Their ability to copy fighting techniques meant Zoro was essentially fighting against himself and learning to overcome his own weaknesses. Mihawk simply provided the initial Haki instruction and left Zoro to develop through combat with these mimicry creatures.
author: One Piece Fandom Community

title: Moria's Fake Death Conspiracy
theoryText: The World Government deliberately spread false news of Gecko Moria's death after Marineford to cover up their attempt to eliminate him. Doflamingo was ordered to kill Moria because he was deemed too weak to continue as a Warlord, but Moria escaped. The government reported him dead while keeping his bounty active, knowing he survived.
author: Multiple fan discussions

title: Shikkearu Kingdom's Fall and Humandrills Evolution
theoryText: The Shikkearu Kingdom on Kuraigana Island fell due to constant civil war, and the humandrills evolved their combat abilities by observing these wars. This demonstrates that violence begets violence - the humandrills became violent warriors only because they witnessed human conflict. Later, when they observed Mihawk and Perona peacefully restoring the island, they learned to become peaceful farmhands, proving their nature is shaped by what they observe.
author: Fan analysis based on canon
